solution_line_template: She works {main_job_hours_per_day} hours a day at ${main_job_hourly_rate} an hour so she makes {main_job_hours_per_day}*{main_job_hourly_rate} = $<<{main_job_hours_per_day}*{main_job_hourly_rate}={main_job_daily_earnings}>>{main_job_daily_earnings} a day

She works this job {work_days_per_week} days a week so she makes {main_job_daily_earnings}*{work_days_per_week} = $<<{main_job_daily_earnings}*{work_days_per_week}={main_job_weekly_earnings}>>{main_job_weekly_earnings} in {work_days_per_week} days

She works {part_time_job_hours_per_day} hours a day at ${part_time_job_hourly_rate} an hour so she makes {part_time_job_hours_per_day}*{part_time_job_hourly_rate} = $<<{part_time_job_hours_per_day}*{part_time_job_hourly_rate}={part_time_job_daily_earnings}>>{part_time_job_daily_earnings} a day

She works this job {work_days_per_week} days a week so she makes {part_time_job_daily_earnings}*{work_days_per_week} = $<<{part_time_job_daily_earnings}*{work_days_per_week}={part_time_job_weekly_earnings}>>{part_time_job_weekly_earnings}

She makes ${main_job_weekly_earnings} at her main job and ${part_time_job_weekly_earnings} at her part-time job so all total she makes {main_job_weekly_earnings}+{part_time_job_weekly_earnings} = $<<{main_job_weekly_earnings}+{part_time_job_weekly_earnings}={total_weekly_earnings}>>{total_weekly_earnings} in {work_days_per_week} days
